author: cnbc.com
title: Inogen reports 4Q loss
text:
GOLETA, Calif. (AP) _ Inogen Inc. (INGN) on Tuesday reported a fourth-quarter loss of $606,000, after reporting a profit in the same period a year earlier.
On a per-share basis, the Goleta, California-based company said it had a loss of 3 cents. Earnings, adjusted for pretax expenses, came to 31 cents per share.
The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of four analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 21 cents per share.
The produces oxygen concentrators for patients suffering from chronic respiratory conditions posted revenue of $63.8 million in the period, also exceeding Street forecasts. Three analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $62 million.
For the year, the company reported profit of $21 million, or 96 cents per share. Revenue was reported as $249.4 million.
Inogen expects full-year revenue in the range of $298 million to $308 million.
Inogen shares have increased nearly 10 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, shares hit $130.60, a climb of 89 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on INGN at https://www.zacks.com/ap/INGN
